@graph.text: Which would you rather stick to?

headline: Keto Stuffed Peppers
name: Keto Stuffed Peppers
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°. In a large pot over medium heat, add bacon and cook until crispy, 8 minutes. Drain on a paper towel–lined plate.  Add onion to pot and cook until soft, 5 minutes. Add beef and cook, breaking up meat with a wooden spoon until no longer pink, 7 minutes. Add chili powder, cumin, oregano, and paprika. Season with salt and pepper.  Add broth and tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let simmer until slightly thickened, 20 minutes.  Place bell pepper halves in a large baking dish and fill with chili. Top with cheddar and bacon and bake until cheese is melty and peppers are softened, about 30 minutes.   Garnish with green onions before serving.

video.description: If you're on the Keto diet then you will love these keto stuffed peppers. Easy to make and such a delicious meal!
video.name: Keto Stuffed Peppers Couldn't Be More Satisfying

review.reviewBody:
OMG!! Delicious! 
So I like many others here initially thought it was too much liquid. It was not. It DID have to cook much longer than 20 minutes however. The liquid WILL reduce (go watch tv or something). P.S. it will also take much longer in the oven, unless you like a raw pepper.

I do not measure my seasonings... I sprinkle until it feels right and then I taste throughout the cooking and add more if necessary (it was totally necessary).

The only adjustments to the core recipe I'd make is.. put some cheese in the pepper first, meat filling then cheese it again. Also cover the dish in the oven so the peppers could steam. When you can pierce side of pepper with fork easily, uncover and let cheese brown.

This was amazing. My only issue now is... can I have another one?
Definitely needs more time to cook.  I increased the time to 45 minutes and it came out much better.   I also added riced califlower and some flax seed for a bit of texture.   It is indeed delish!
Excellent recipe! I did not use beef broth at all. Water in tomatoes was enough for me. Took about 15-20 minutes to reduce. Spices are spot on. I will definitely make again. Thank you so much!!!!!
This is good but i only did 2 tsp paprika.  I cooked mine for 45 min and topped with cheese the last 10 min.  next time I make it i will only use 1/2 tbsp chili powder
Stuffed peppers were very good. Recipe was easy to make and I had all the ingredients and didn’t need to go to the store. I would definitely make this again.
It is a great idea. I feel bad for you, some people seem to enjoy pointing out things to make them feel better about themselves.

I just made this - good recipe.  The meat mixture was a bit watery so I think I would drain the tomatoes next time.  I did not use the green onion garnish.  I also learned that red and green peppers have fewer carbs than yellow peppers.  I calculated the grams of carbs and listed this info in my response to GreenBug.

DO NOT USE THIS RECIPE. I'm currently making this recipe and can not recommend it.  I followed the recipe by the book.  Using TWO cups of broth leaves you with chili soup...it will not simmer down and thicken in 20 minutes.  I drained as much liquid as I could and ended up adding the cheese to the chili mixture to thicken it up.  As for the spices, even with that amount of spice, the filling doesn't really stand out...in other words, I thought it somewhat bland.

IMHO...Makenzie Gore probably copied a recipe from another website and tried to change the ingredients a bit to make it unique to Delish.  To get what you have in the photo, you'd have to omit the broth.  That is where I made my mistake.  The filling was just fine with the tomatoes and their juices.  Adding the broth?  A BIG MISTAKE.  I ended up simmering for 40 minutes in the vain hope I'd have something more than really soupy chili. I am currently drinking the chili broth...waste not, want not.

description: If you're on a Keto diet, then you will love these Keto Stuffed Peppers. Filled with a spiced ground beef and bacon mixture, they're an amazing make-ahead meal.
keywords: best keto stuffed peppers, best stuffed peppers, classic stuffed peppers, gluten-free stuffed peppers, bacon stuffed peppers, ground beef stuffed peppers, cheesy stuffed peppers, cheddar stuffed peppers, grain-free stuffed peppers, no rice stuffed peppers, ground beef recipes, dinner ideas, ground beef and peppers recipe,
